title: 'Just getting started': Wemby, Spurs take out OKC
content: Finally whole with the return of Victor Wembanyama, the Spurs took a big step forward in showing they're title contenders in a 111-109 win over the defending champion Thunder.

title: QB Mendoza first Hoosier to win Heisman Trophy
content: Indiana's Fernando Mendoza, who guided the Hoosiers to their first No. 1 ranking and the top seed in the 12-team CFP bracket by throwing for 2,980 yards and a national-best 33 touchdown passes, won the Heisman Trophy on Saturday night.

title: Gottlieb on Brown shooting: 'We can all be better'
content: An emotional Lindsay Gottlieb said, "It doesn't need to be this way" in response to a deadly shooting at her alma mater, Brown University.

title: Source: Colts expected to start Rivers vs. Seattle
content: Philip Rivers, who came out of retirement this week to help the Colts address their void at quarterback, is expected to start Sunday against the Seahawks, a source told ESPN.

title: Cena retires from wrestling after submission loss
content: Before a stunned crowd, John Cena signaled to fans that his time is finally over, tapping out on a sleeper hold from Gunther at "Saturday Night's Main Event."

title: 49ers place injured Aiyuk on reserve/left team list
content: The 49ers placed Brandon Aiyuk on the reserve/left team list on Saturday, likely ending the receiver's tenure in San Francisco.

title: Navy goes for it, beats Army on 4th-and-goal TD
content: Trailing 16-10, Navy went for it on fourth down and scored the winning touchdown when Blake Horvath found Eli Heidenreich in the end zone to lift the Midshipmen past Army 17-16.

content: Before John Cena's final match, take a look back at his legendary career through the lens of his iconic shirts.

title: "Young, Industrious": What PM Modi Said About New BJP Chief Nitin Nabin
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday congratulated Bihar Minister Nitin Nabin upon his appointment as the Bharatiya Janata Party's National Working President.

title: Found IED In Car Linked To Sydney Beach Shooter: Australia Police
content: Australian police said an "improvised explosive device" had been found in a car linked to a suspect in a deadly shooting Sunday at Sydney's Bondi Beach.

title: Top Australian Muslim Organisation Condemns Sydney Beach Attack
content: A major Australian Muslim organisation condemned a "horrific" shooting on Sunday that killed ten people on Sydney's Bondi Beach.

title: After Deadly Australia Beach Attack, Netanyahu's "Oil On Fire" Remark
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu accused Australia's government of having fuelled antisemitism in the period leading up to Sunday's shooting in Sydney which targeted a Jewish celebration, killing 11 people.

title: Alleged Australia Beach Shooter's Pic Viral: What Police Chief Said
content: One of the alleged Bondi Beach shooters has been identified as Naveed Akram from Bonnyrigg, Sydney, according to a senior law enforcement official. Police raided the 24-year-old's home Sunday evening as part of the ongoing investigation, as per repor

title: Woman's Body Found In Haryana, Police Say Killed by Former Boyfriend
content: The decapitated body of a young woman has been found in Yamunanagar, Haryana. The police have arrested the accused, Furkan alias Bilal, who was her former boyfriend.

title: Sydney Bondi Beach Shooting Revives Memories Of 1996 Port Arthur Massacre
content: At least 11 people were killed after two gunmen opened fire at Sydney's Bondi Beach on Sunday during a Jewish religious gathering. One of the attackers was shot dead by police as emergency services rushed to the scene.

title: Probe Agency ED Busts Rs 2,300-Crore Crypto Scam Across Himachal, Punjab
content: The Enforcement Directorate conducted coordinated search operations at eight locations across Himachal Pradesh and Punjab on Saturday in connection with a fake cryptocurrency-based Ponzi and Multi-Level Marketing (MLM) scam.

title: "Bloodbath, Massacre": October 7 Attack Survivor Injured In Sydney Shooting
content: Among those injured in the shooting at a Jewish religious event in Australia is a man who survived the October 7 Hamas attacks in Israel and had recently shifted to Australia

title: Union Minister Of State For Finance Pankaj Chaudhary Named UP BJP Chief
content: Union Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary was on Sunday named the new president of the BJP's Uttar Pradesh unit, with his election being formally announced by Union Minister Piyush Goyal here.

title: Australia Mass Shooting Updates: PM Modi Condemns Bondi Beach Attack That Killed 11
content: At least 12 people, including the shooter have been killed after two gunmen opened fire at Sydney's Bondi Beach on Sunday.

title: On CCTV, Scooter Rider Hits Man From Behind, Then Shoots Him In Amritsar
content: A shooting incident left two people injured and created panic at a residential area in Punjab's Amritsar. The injured people - a man and a woman - have been admitted to a hospital.

content: A high-level alert regarding a terror attack on Jewish festival Hanukkah was recently issued in India, sources have said.

title: Aspiring Footballers Under 13 To Meet Messi During GOAT Tour's Mumbai Leg

title: 11 Killed In Mass Shooting At Australia's Bondi Beach During Jewish Festival
content: At least 10 people were shot dead after two gunmen opened fire at Sydney's Bondi Beach today. According to witnesses, around 50 shots were fired during the shooting that took place around two hours ago.

title: Video: How An Unarmed Man Took Sydney Shooter By Surprise, Saved Lives
content: Eleven people have been killed in mass shooting that took place around two hours ago. According to eye witnesses, the two gunmen fired around 50 shots.

title: Technology Should Amplify Human Judgment, Not Replace It: Chief Justice Surya Kant
content: Chief Justice of India Surya Kant on Sunday said technology should amplify human judgment and not replace it.

title: Madhya Pradesh Minister's Remarks On Ladli Behna Beneficiaries Spark Outrage
content: Madhya Pradesh Cabinet Minister and Ratlam district in-charge Vijay Shah has landed in another controversy, days after facing criticism over his remarks related to Colonel Sophia Qureshi.

title: Dense Fog Leads To Massive Pile-Up On Haryana Highway, Many Drivers Injured
content: At least three dozen vehicles, including trucks and buses, crashed into each other on a highway in Haryana's Rohtak on Sunday after dense fog reduced visibility to a minimum.

content: The criminal sections-loaded FERA of 1973 was replaced in June 2000 by the Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA) of 1999, a civil law

content: The proposed meeting is to be held between 11 a.m. and 1 p.m. on a 19-acre portion of the 31-acre land belonging to the Sri Vijayapuri Amman Temple at Moongilpalayam village

title: Hassan Airport: A project grounded for over six decades
content: Hardly any progress in the construction of Hassan Airport in the last two years. Minister M.B. Patil had assured the project would be completed by 2024-25.

content: Pt. Sarothy‚Äôs performance was part of Swaraanand Pratishthan‚Äôs Baithak music programme held at the University‚Äôs College‚Äôs Ravindra Kalabhavan.

content: Kerala Pradesh Congress Committee (KPCC) president Sunny Joseph, MLA, said welfare pension was an inalienable right and not CPI(M)‚Äôs charity

title: Nearly 4 GW of solar capacity in Rajasthan hit by transmission constraints
content: Solar power generation in Rajasthan has been severely hit as over 4.3 GW of solar capacity is being fully curtailed during daytime due to transmission shortages, leaving power plants unable to evacuate electricity to the grid and putting projects worth nearly ‚Çπ20,000 crore at risk, according to industry sources

content: The collaboration envisages the development of green energy capacity up to 2000 MW to be implemented in phases

content: Mr. Ravibabu said that lack of funds is only a pretext to privatise the medical colleges constructed with a lot of effort by the Jagan Mohan Reddy government

content: Speaking to The Hindu, he alleged that TDP had spread rumours and created fear among the people with regard to land reforms on the pretext that the then CM Y.S. Jagan Mohan Reddy‚Äôs photo was printed on the passbooks

title: Study shows evidence of growing early gestational diabetes among pregnant women
content: Gestational Diabetes Mellitus¬†(GDM) is glucose intolerance first diagnosed during pregnancy, and is typically diagnosed between 24-28 weeks gestation, though earlier onset is also possible

content: Bank accounts of shell entities used to allegedly route over ‚Çπ1,000 crore, with one account alone receiving funds exceeding ‚Çπ152 crore within a short span

content: ‚ÄúMr. Sarip stayed in the seminary from November 30 to December 2. He had reportedly come to visit another Filipino student, Mohammed Yasir,‚Äù says Hasanganj police station Sub-Inspector

content: The panel members, headed by retired Calcutta High Court judge Justice Ashim Kumar Ray, will conduct the probe, they said

title: Parliament panel says Sonam Wangchuk's HIAL doing exemplary work, should be given UGC recognition
content: The committee, headed by Congress MP Digvijaya Singh recommended that the Ministry of Education closely study the HIAL model and consider how it can be replicated

title: Centre asks States to prioritise women, SC/ST officers for Central deputation
content: "Sufficient names of women and SC and ST officers may be sponsored so that adequate representation can be provided to them," says communique dated December 10

title: 8% polling recorded till 10 a.m. in zila parishad, panchayat samiti elections in Punjab
content: The polling began at 8 a.m. amid tight security arrangements and is slated to continue till 4 p.m.; the counting of votes will take place on December 17.

title: Parliamentary panel recommends easing clearances for underground coal mining projects
content: The government has set a target to produce 100 million tonnes (MT) of coal from underground coal mines by 2030

title: ICAR-CIFT conducted training programme for stakeholders
content: The objective of the programme was to sensitise the stakeholders on the technologies available for value addition of seafood, fish waste utilisation, seaweed products and business promotion activities

title: Cough syrup case: Lavish Lucknow mansion of arrested ex-constable draws focus amid ED raids
content: Special Task Force of the Uttar Pradesh Police arrested Constable Alok Pratap Singh, who had been dismissed from service twice, on December 2, 2025

title: Goa cracks down on illegal nightclubs ahead of Christmas and New Year
content: Goa gears up for its busiest fortnight spanning Christmas and New Year, the crackdown has already forced some nightclubs to shut, while the fate of others hangs in the balance

title: HPV vaccination camp held for children of police personnel
content: The HPV vaccination camp was organised for girl children, of police personnel and home guards, in the age group of 9 to 14 years

title: Wildfire rages in famed Dzukou Valley for third day, aerial operations likely to be conducted
content: Sources said the aerial assessment was carried out after a drone appraisal could not be undertaken due to the difficult terrain

title: Fire at autorickshaw godown in Thane; no casualty
content: The authorities were alerted at 5:45 a.m. about the blaze at the godown, where autorickshaws were kept, at Kalher in the Bhiwandi area, says a fire official

title: Six militants arrested in Manipur for extortion
content: Two active women cadres of the United National Liberation Front (Koireng) were nabbed from the Moirangkampu Sajeb Makha Leikai area in Imphal East district

title: Sydney shooting: Bystander tackles gunman at Bondi Beach; heroic act caught on camera
content: Chaos erupted at Sydney's Bondi Beach as a gunman opened fire, killing at least 11 people. A dramatic video shows a brave bystander tackling the shooter and disarming him amidst the panic. Police have apprehended two individuals following the terrifying incident near a Hanukkah event.  The scene was one of widespread fear and immediate medical response.

title: BJP gets new chief: Bihar minister Nitin Nabin appointed working president
content: Nitin Nabin has been appointed as the new national working president of the Bharatiya Janata Party, succeeding JP Nadda. A PWD minister in Bihar and MLA from Patna's Bankipur constituency, Nabin's political journey began in student politics with the ABVP. He has established himself as a key urban and infrastructure leader since entering electoral politics in the late 2000s.

title: Sydney: Bondi Beach shooting toll rises to 11; one gunman killed, other critical
content: Multiple shots were reported at Sydney's Bondi Beach, prompting a large police and emergency response. Authorities have urged the public to avoid the area and take shelter. Two individuals have been taken into custody, and several patients are receiving on-site treatment, with some transported to local hospitals.

title: BJP's surprise pick for president: Why Nitin Nabin matters
content: The BJP has appointed Bihar minister Nitin Nabin as its youngest Working National President, highlighting a strategic shift towards experienced, quiet strategists. Nabin's appointment underscores the party's focus on organizational strength and cadre management, particularly with a renewed emphasis on eastern India. This move signals a commitment to loyalty and effective execution in national politics.

title: Population warning: Elon Musk sounds alarm on Europe; flags plummeting birth rates
content: Elon Musk has issued a stark warning about declining birth rates, particularly in Europe, citing Poland's low fertility rate as a critical indicator. He believes a shrinking global population poses an existential threat, hindering humanity's collective consciousness and capacity for progress. Musk emphasizes that having children is crucial for civilization's survival.

title: 'Consistently reiterated position': India rebuts Dhaka's charges; denies hostile acts
content: India has firmly rejected Bangladesh's interim government's assertions, stating New Delhi consistently supports free, fair, and inclusive elections in the neighboring country. India denied allowing its territory to be used for activities hostile to Bangladesh's interests and called on Dhaka to ensure internal law and order for peaceful elections.

title: 'Yeh constable ka ghar hai?: Dismissed UP cop‚Äôs house in posh Lucknow locality sparks outrage
content: A viral video of a dismissed Uttar Pradesh constable's opulent Lucknow residence has stunned social media users. Alok Pratap Singh, arrested for his alleged role in a codeine-based cough syrup smuggling network, reportedly invested in the illicit trade, earning substantial profits far exceeding his official salary. The lavish home has ignited debate on corruption within law enforcement.

title: Microsoft pay row: 8th-largest shareholder questions Nadella‚Äôs raise; blames board
content: Norway's $2 trillion Sovereign Wealth Fund voted against Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella's compensation package and his role as board chair. The fund cited concerns over executive pay transparency and the separation of CEO and chair roles. Despite the fund's opposition, Microsoft's board approved Nadella's increased compensation, citing AI progress.

title: 'There‚Äôs no need for‚Ä¶': Former India coach sends clear message to Shubman Gill
content: Former India batter Sanjay Bangar urged Shubman Gill to focus on stability and proper cricketing shots at the top of the order, rather than big hits. Bangar believes Gill's role is to see off the new ball and absorb pressure, laying the platform for explosive hitters. This advice follows Gill's recent struggles in the T20I series against South Africa.

title: BJP gets new national prez: Who is Nitin Nabin, the Bihar minister who replaced Nadda
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party has appointed Bihar minister Nitin Nabin as its national working president, a significant organizational shift. Nabin, a four-time MLA from Patna's Bankipur constituency, brings extensive grassroots experience and a strong organizational background to the party's national leadership.

title: Brown University shooting: Person of interest in custody; manhunt ends
content: A person of interest is in custody following a deadly shooting at Brown University that claimed two lives and injured nine. The incident, which occurred during a final exam review, triggered a massive manhunt and widespread panic across Providence. Authorities are investigating the motive behind the attack, one of the deadliest on a US campus recently.

title: Climate migration begins: Tuvaluans relocate to Australia; special visas take effect
content: Australia has welcomed the first climate migrants from Tuvalu, a Pacific nation facing inundation due to rising sea levels. A groundbreaking bilateral treaty allows Tuvaluans to live, study, and work in Australia, receiving immediate access to essential services. This initiative offers a dignified pathway as the island nation grapples with existential threats from climate change.

title: 'Zero tolerance towards terrorism': PM Modi condemns 'ghastly' attack in Sydney
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar have strongly condemned the terrorist attack at Sydney's Bondi Beach, which claimed 11 lives and injured 16 others. The attack occurred during a Hanukkah celebration, and India has expressed solidarity with Australia, reiterating its zero-tolerance policy towards terrorism.

title: 'Our fight is against RSS, BJP; against gaddars indulging in vote chori': Kharge at Congress rally
content: The Congress intensified its campaign against alleged vote manipulation and electoral roll revisions with a massive rally in Delhi. Leaders like Mallikarjun Kharge and Rahul Gandhi addressed the gathering, accusing the government of stealing mandates and questioning the Election Commission's impartiality. The party claims to have collected over five crore signatures nationwide to highlight these concerns.

title: Sydney: Bondi Beach mass shooting declared 'terror incident' - top developments
content: A violent mass shooting by two gunmen at Sydney's famous Bondi Beach during a Chanukah celebration left nine people dead and several injured. One attacker was killed by police, while another was tackled by a bystander before being arrested. The attack has drawn widespread condemnation from national and international leaders.

title: Sydney terror attack: IED found in car linked to Bondi Beach shooting; probe widens
content: Sydney's Bondi Beach was rocked by a terrorist attack during Hanukkah festivities, with two gunmen killing 11 and injuring several. Authorities discovered an improvised explosive device in a vehicle linked to one of the deceased attackers. Prime Minister Albanese condemned the targeted act of hate, emphasizing it was an attack on all Australians.

title: 'Dhurandhar' box office day 10: Ranveer, Akshaye Khanna, R Madhavan starrer crosses Rs 300 cr
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' has shattered expectations, crossing the ‚Çπ300 crore mark in its second week. The film, directed by Aditya Dhar, opened strong and maintained impressive momentum, especially with a remarkable ‚Çπ53 crore collection on its second Saturday.  This massive success has left audiences and industry watchers astounded.

title: Joey Porter Sr. admits Dolphins years hurt his family and passion for football
content: Joey Porter Sr. revealed the profound impact of his time with the struggling Miami Dolphins, which contrasted sharply with his winning culture in Pittsburgh.  The constant losses deeply affected his family, turning game days into dreaded events and forcing him to re-evaluate his role as both a player and father.

title: AQI ‚Äòsevere plus‚Äô in Delhi: CAQM suspends all outdoor sports; warns of serious health risks to kids
content: Delhi-NCR's air quality has plunged to 'severe plus', prompting the Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) to halt all outdoor sports activities. This directive, aimed at protecting children's health, comes as the strictest Stage IV of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) is enforced. Construction bans and truck entry restrictions are also in effect, with schools adopting hybrid learning.

title: ‚Äò140+ all day‚Äô: Faster and fitter Shivam Mavi ready for IPL return | Exclusive
content: After three injury-hit years away from the IPL, Shivam Mavi feels reborn. Having fixed action-related side-flexion issues, the 27-year-old has played consistently for Uttar Pradesh across formats, clocking 140+ consistently.

title: Mass shooting at Bondi Beach: Australian PM Albanese calls situation ‚Äòdistressing‚Äô
content: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese expressed shock following a mass shooting at Sydney's Bondi Beach, where multiple fatalities were reported. Emergency services are on the scene, with eight individuals transported to hospitals. The Prime Minister is coordinating with state officials and urging those nearby to follow police instructions.

title: ‚ÄòDifficult times‚Äô: Hamas confirms top commander Raed Saad killed in Israeli strike
content: Hamas confirmed the killing of senior leader Raed Saad and aides by Israeli forces, a day after Israel announced the operation. Saad, described as an architect of the October 7 attack and second-in-command of Hamas's armed wing, was reportedly killed in Gaza's tunnel network. This development risks further destabilizing the fragile truce.

title: Uttar Pradesh: BJP unanimously elects Pankaj Chaudhary state president; who is he?
content: Pankaj Chaudhary, Union Minister of State for Finance, has been unanimously elected as the Uttar Pradesh BJP president. A seven-time MP from Maharajganj, Chaudhary began his political career at the grassroots level. His appointment ahead of key political challenges is seen as a thoughtful decision by the party high command.

title: 'We hid in the dark': How fear & sirens took over Brown University; students narrate 'nightmare'
content: Gunshots erupted at Brown University, sending students into lockdown and triggering a massive manhunt. The attack inside an engineering building resulted in two fatalities and multiple injuries. Authorities released suspect footage, urging the public to report any information as the campus grappled with the sudden violence.

title: Jaiswal sends loud message to Gambhir after Gill‚Äôs T20I struggles
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal smashed a sensational 101 off 48 balls, leading Mumbai to a remarkable four-wicket victory over Haryana in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. This dominant chase, the second-highest in tournament history, saw Jaiswal's brilliant century, supported by Sarfaraz Khan's quickfire 64, propel Mumbai to a memorable win.

title: Fact Check: Is China carrying out a massive military build-up near Arunachal Pradesh? Here's the truth behind viral claim
content: PIB has debunked viral claims of a large-scale Chinese military build-up near Arunachal Pradesh. The government's fact-checking agency clarified that the circulated video depicts a routine exercise by the PLA's 78th Group Army, unrelated to the Indian border. Citizens are urged to verify information from official sources.

title: 'Severely damaging': Domestic industry warns against 'zero-duty imports under FTAs'
content: India's domestic copper manufacturing faces severe damage from cheap imports under free trade agreements, according to the Indian Primary Copper Producers Association. The industry body urges the government to implement safeguard duties and quantitative restrictions to protect investments and prevent the erosion of the smelting and downstream manufacturing base.

title: Punjab road tragedy: Couple die as car plunges into drain amid dense fog; were heading for poll duty
content: An English teacher, Jaskaran Singh Bhullar, and his wife, Kanmaljit Kaur, tragically died in a road accident on Sunday morning. While driving to drop his wife for election duty, their car fell into a drain near Sangatpura village in Moga district. Police suspect fog as the cause of the accident, leaving the teacher fraternity in shock.

title: Four hours of waiting, over 1 lakh students in limbo, two outcomes: Why DU‚Äôs exam delay hit them differently
content: Delhi University‚Äôs semester exams descended into chaos after question papers for over 35 subjects reached centres up to four hours late, affecting more than one lakh students. While Honours students were cushioned by additional exam slots, Programme students faced rescheduling and extended uncertainty. The episode exposes how DU‚Äôs exam design distributes disruption unequally.

title: Rs 200cr drug bust: Wardha MD racket mastermind ran lab 2km from police station; fixed their CCTVs
content: A computer repairman, Vaibhav Agarwal, was arrested as the mastermind of a Rs200 crore MD drug manufacturing racket in Wardha. He learned drug synthesis online and used his familiarity with police routines to operate a clandestine lab near a police station. DRI busted the unit, seizing 128kg of MD and advanced equipment.

title: When Messi mania turned messy: Chairs thrown, sofa set on fire ‚Äî Inside the Kolkata chaos
content: Lionel Messi's brief 22-minute appearance at Salt Lake stadium ended in chaos as 60,000 disgruntled fans, unable to see the star, erupted in violence. Frustration over poor visibility and absent celebrities led to mayhem, including arson, vandalism, and a police lathi-charge, lasting over an hour.

title: D-Street outlook: What could drive the market this upcoming week? Key cues to watch
content: Indian markets navigated macroeconomic pressures and global uncertainties this week. A weakening rupee was partially offset by a US Federal Reserve rate cut and optimism around India-US trade talks. While foreign investors sold equities, domestic buying provided support. Investors will watch trade developments and key economic data for direction.

title: No relief: Organiser of Messi Kolkata event denied bail; sent to 14-day police custody
content: Football icon Lionel Messi's G.O.A.T India Tour 2025 organiser, Satadru Dutta, was arrested at Kolkata airport and sent to 14 days' police custody. The arrest followed chaos at the Salt Lake Stadium event, which was cut short, disappointing thousands of fans. Dutta denied responsibility for the disruption.

title: Mumbai tops road traffic CO2 emissions/km; Delhi & Bengaluru among nation‚Äôs top 3 ‚Äî key findings
content: Mumbai leads Indian cities in road traffic CO‚ÇÇ emissions per km due to high vehicle density. A new study reveals major metros like Delhi and Bengaluru also show significant NOx and CO pollution. The research, part of the CHETNA project, mapped emissions across 15 cities at a 500-meter resolution.

title: Brown University shooting: 1st visuals surface showing gunman; massive manhunt launched
content: The FBI released footage of a suspect in the Brown University shooting that killed two and injured nine. The individual, seen in black, was walking past a traffic light, though their face was not visible. Investigators are still determining how the shooter gained access to the classroom where the incident began.

title: Roars and leaps! Vaibhav Suryavanshi fails to fire, Pakistan go wild in celebration - Watch
content: The Pakistan dugout rose to its feet and applauded as Vaibhav Suryavanshi, who had tormented bowlers in the previous match, was sent back early. After completing the catch, Sayyam threw the ball into the air and leapt in celebration, with his teammates rushing in to hug him as Pakistan celebrated a massive early success against their arch-rivals.

title: U19 Asia Cup: India maintain ‚Äòno handshake‚Äô; avoid eye contact with Pakistan
content: At the toss, neither Ayush Mhatre nor Pakistan skipper Farhan Yousaf initiated the customary exchange of pleasantries. After Pakistan won the toss and chose to bowl first, the two captains avoided eye contact, gave their respective interviews, and proceeded to their dressing rooms.

title: Messi event chaos: Organiser stopped from fleeing Kolkata in chartered plane
content: Event organiser Satadru Dutta was arrested at Kolkata airport, preventing him from leaving the city after the chaotic Lionel Messi show at Salt Lake Stadium. Thousands of fans were left disappointed by the aborted programme, with allegations of mismanagement surfacing. Police confirmed investigations are underway into the fiasco.

title: Fact-check: Bronny James baby rumor with Parker Whitfield debunked amid viral hoax
content: A viral X post claimed LeBron James' son Bronny James is expecting a child with girlfriend Parker Whitfield, but the rumor lacks substantiation and is believed to be a diversion. Bronny and Parker, who have been dating since August 2024, are a popular couple, with Bronny expressing his affection for her on Instagram.

title: Dwyane Wade Says ‚ÄúI‚Äôll Miss Him‚Äù in Emotional Tribute to LeBron James
content: Dwyane Wade, reflecting on LeBron James' 23rd NBA season, expresses admiration and a fan's perspective on an impending era's end.  He acknowledges James' elite performance, even as fans call for retirement, and cherishes their shared championship history. Wade also humorously recalls the 'Big Three' introduction, highlighting the immense pressure and difficulty of winning.

title: David and Victoria Beckham net worth 2025: Football, fashion, business
content: Power couple David and Victoria Beckham boast a combined net worth of $900 million in 2025. David's fortune stems from his legendary football career and lucrative endorsements, while Victoria built hers through successful fashion and beauty empires.  Together, they manage valuable brands, support their family, and remain influential figures in global sports and fashion.

title: South Africa: India-origin man among 4 killed in temple collapse; illegal construction cited
content: An under-construction Hindu temple collapsed in South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal province, killing four people, including an Indian-origin executive. The four-storey structure, built without approved plans, was being expanded when it fell. Rescue operations were hampered by weather, and the number of individuals still trapped remains unclear.

title: Rs 5L murder deal: MP teen hires minors to kill parents; here's what happened
content: A teenager allegedly hired minors for Rs 5 lakh to kill his father and stepmother over a property dispute. The brutal attack resulted in the deaths of his father and a domestic help, while his stepmother was critically injured. The motive stemmed from perceived family and inheritance slights.
